title: Drawing, "Wall Decoration, Blue (South) Drawing Room", 1815–22
medium: Watercolor over graphite on white wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Vertical rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. A panel of a wall showing five paintings of Chinese scenes and figures, enclosed in lattice-work frames, against a neutral blue background. The entire panel is contained within a border of geometric design.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Wall Decoration, Blue (South) Drawing Room", 1815–22.
1815–22. Watercolor over graphite on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-61.
